meanings.definition: To cause feelings of disappointment or annoyance in
meanings.sent1: The constant rain would frustrate the picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: She felt frustrated when her computer froze during an important presentation.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the knot in her necklace only seemed to frustrate her more.
meanings.sent4: The maze of rules and regulations can frustrate even the most patient person.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending traffic jam was enough to frustrate anyone's patience.

meanings.definition: To prevent from accomplishing a purpose or fulfilling a desire
meanings.sent1: The locked door frustrated their escape from the room.
meanings.sent2: The lack of resources frustrated their efforts to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to frustrate the cat's attempts to catch it.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog frustrated their attempts to navigate through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The strict security measures frustrated any attempts to sneak into the building.
